roleset.name: make happy, cheerful
roleset.note: CHEER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cheer' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from cheer.01-v predicate notes)

role.descr: instrument or manner, only when separate from agent

example.name: passivized
example.text: While bond investors would have preferred growth to be a little slower, [they]-2 were cheered *trace*-2 by inflation measures in the data that showed prices rising at a modest annual rate of 2.9%.
example.arg: While bond investors would have preferred growth to be a little slower
by inflation measures in the data that showed prices rising at a modest annual rate of 2.9 %

example.name: with instrument
example.text: Mary cheered John with a hot-fudge sundae.

roleset.name: applaud, cheer for
roleset.note: CHEER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cheer' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from cheer.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: PP approval
example.text: 50% of voters cheered for the President's job performance.

example.name: NP approval
example.text: Shareholders cheered Pacific First Financial's acquisition by Royal Trustco Ltd of Toronto for $27 a share, or $212 million.
example.arg: Pacific First Financial's acquisition by Royal Trustco Ltd of Toronto for $27 a share, or $212 million.

example.name: all args
example.text: Mary cheered John up with a hot-fudge sundae.

example.name: NP approval
example.text: 50% of voters cheered on the President's job performance.
